Package Utils

Class TimeUtils

java.lang.Object
Utils.TimeUtils
public class TimeUtils extends Object
A utility class for performing various tasks with dates, times, and timezones.

  • Constructor Details

    • TimeUtils

      public TimeUtils()

  • Method Details

    • inMonth

      public static boolean inMonth(Timestamp time, String month)
      Checks if a Timestamp is within a given month represented by a string. eg. "January"
      Parameters:
      time - : A Timestamp containing a date and time.
      month - : String for what month to test the timestamp is in. For example: "January", "February" etc. This value is case-insensitive so "january" and "JANUARY" are all valid String values.
      Returns:
      boolean: returns a boolean indicating if the Timestamp: time passed in was within the month passed in as a String. For example: If we had a timestamp that evaluated to this String: '2022-11-11 11:15:00' That Timestamp is in the 11th month, which is November. String values for month "November", "NOVEMBER", "november" etc. would all return true.

    • buildTimeStamp

      public static Timestamp buildTimeStamp(Timestamp day, int hour, int minute, String amPm)
      Returns a timestamp from several components that are added together to make the final Timestamp.
      Parameters:
      day - - A timestamp that is exactly midnight of a date selected by the user from a calendar.
      hour - - int specifying the number of hours from midnight. 8 is 8am and 13 is 1pm and so on.
      minute - - int specifying the number of minutes from the beginning of the hour.
      amPm - - String indicating AM or PM. Case Insensitive.
      Returns:
      - a Timestamp object built from time data in integers and strings passed in to this function

    • militaryToCivilianHour

      public static int militaryToCivilianHour(int hour)
      Takes hours from midnight in military time and return int indicating the hour in civilian time.
      Parameters:
      hour - - int specifying how many hours from midnight in military time.
      Returns:
      - int specifying the hour in civilian time. Note. Does not specify AM or PM, just returns the int. For example, an input of 13 will return an output of 1. An input of 1 will return an output of 1. An input of 22 will return 10, for 10pm, and so on.

    • getAMPMFromHour

      public static String getAMPMFromHour(int hour)
      Take an integer value for the hours from midnight in military time, and returns the string "AM" or PM. 13 will return the value "PM". The value 1 will return the value "AM" and so on.
      Parameters:
      hour - - an integer value for the hours from midnight in military time.
      Returns:
      - the String "AM" or "PM" depending on if the hour passed in is more than 12 hours from midnight.

    • withinOfficeHours

      public static boolean withinOfficeHours(Timestamp start, Timestamp end)
      Takes two Timestamps for the start and end time of an Appointment, and returns a boolean indicating if that Timestamp is withing the office hours of 8am to 10pm in the Eastern Time zone.
      Parameters:
      start - - A Timestamp for the start time of an appointment in UTC
      end - - A Timestamp for the end time of an appointment in UTC
      Returns:
      - a boolean indicating if the Timestamp is within the office hours of 8am to 10pm in the Eastern time zone.

    • getNowLocalTimeString

      public static String getNowLocalTimeString()
      Get the current time in the local time of the users computer. Application will check the current time zone using the operating system of the users machine.
      Returns:
      - the current time in a human-readable String format.

    • getNowEasternTimeString

      public static String getNowEasternTimeString()
      Get the current time converted to the Eastern time zone. The office appointments are scheduled at is located in the Eastern time zone and all appointments must be made within 8am-10pm offices hours Eastern Time.
      Returns:
      - Eastern time stamp for the current time at function call in a human-readable String format.

    • isWithin15Minute

      public static String isWithin15Minute()
      Checks if the database contains any appointments within the next 15 minutes of the current moment.
      Returns:
      - A string containing the next appointment and its timestamp if it starts within the next 15 minutes, or else a string saying that no appointments were found starting within the next 15 minutes.
